This is not a JUnit problem. Please review how to use the keyword
"super" within a method to call the parent class' implementation of a
method. If you need further help, you are best to read one of several
excellent Java tutorials on the subject. Also read up on inheritance
and the reasons for which a subclass' implementation of a method can
narrow the set of exceptions to throw, but not expand it. 

Good luck.

*********** REPLY SEPARATOR  ***********

On 2002-07-18 at 22:12 parul_49 wrote:

>Hi,
>I have a question regarding the running to the setup methods.
>
>I have a parent class that extends the TestCase.
>All my other testClasses extend this parent class.
>
>I have a setup in the parent and a setup in the child classes.
>
>I have however seen that the parent's setup is executed, however the 
>child setup is never executed.
>
>The parent setup throws 2 exceptions and the child classes setup does 
>not throw any. I dont know if this is the reason, but I cant seem to 
>get the child classes setup rbe executed.
>Any ideas?
>
>
